intro: Sisymbrium flexicaule, commonly known as narrowleaf mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its fruits are slender pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Sisymbrium flexicaule is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
